title: (VTC) Beginners Programming C
description:
*Learn C programming language, via VTC video tutorials*
*Author of Video Training Course: Tim Heagarty* 
*in .UIF*



*All files scanned with Bitdefender Anti-Virus before uploading (its clean)



*All video clips in .mov files (use QuickTime/VLC player)



*** 

For those without a clue how to use/open .uif&#039;s :
 
- MSwindows users use magicISO 
 <a href="
http://www.magiciso.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.magiciso.com/</a>

- People new to *NIX or GNU/Linux users can use UIF2ISO and then mount the .iso after. 
   <a href="
http://freshmeat.net/projects/uif2iso/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://freshmeat.net/projects/uif2iso/</a>
  
(*NIX users can also try running magicISO in WINE/Cedega/Crossover, or by using VMs like Xen, VMware, VirtualBox, KVM, Qemu, ...etc-etc.)
